problem.markdown:
>>What does it mean when we say "a system reaches steady-state"?<<
[x] All time derivatives equal to 0 [ ] The more arrivals into the system [ ] The utilization rate approaches 0 [x] The steady-state probabilities will not change with respect to time
[explanation] When a system enters steady-state, we assume that the system has run long enough, such that it is settling at a constant. In this context, it means the probability of being in a certain state is approaching a constant. Thus, time derivatives are set to 0, and probabilities will no longer change as a function of time. [explanation]
